title: raritycheck
author: raritycheck
content: Hello allWhat's a good price for graded MS 68- 0.1 silver Cas in the current market?Regards

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Personally, I have no idea and probably many others do not either since we haven't seen one in quite some time...Have you considered S&B? It's probably what I would do... https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5450443.0Have talked to James as well, great guy, very smart and willing to help.  Good luck, I hope you get the most out of this. I once had a yellow anacs MS70 but sold it in a down market and broke even, but had I waited, oh jeez.... Bad mistake on my part! @Bavicrypto, I hope you still have this gem!

comments.author: blucepheus
comments.body: .1 Cas is perhaps the most desirable silver Cas given the low denomination and wide appeal, and that’s a fantastic grade. I imagine it could sell for around .7 these days.

comments.author: goldlyre
comments.body: Quote from: blucepheus on May 19, 2023, 02:24:50 AM.1 Cas is perhaps the most desirable silver Cas given the low denomination and wide appeal, and that’s a fantastic grade. I imagine it could sell for around .7 these days.That'll be absolutely awesome!

comments.author: Humble Bitcoiners
comments.body: Last MS 68 sold in March for around 11k plus a horrible 20% fee (13,2k total).... 0.4 Btc... But that was Stacks & Bowers https://auctions.stacksbowers.com/auctions/3-11DVT6/spring-2023-auction-session-9-cryptocurrency-lots-8001-8303?limit=36

comments.author: raritycheck
comments.body: Quote from: Humble Bitcoiners on May 19, 2023, 01:45:52 PMLast MS 68 sold in March for around 11k plus a horrible 20% fee (13,2k total).... 0.4 Btc... But that was Stacks & Bowers https://auctions.stacksbowers.com/auctions/3-11DVT6/spring-2023-auction-session-9-cryptocurrency-lots-8001-8303?limit=36Thank you all.Will try SW then
